definition: to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game

sentences.english: Thus, we have put short quiz to a climax.
sentences.chinese: 於是，我們把短片競猜這一部分推向了高潮。

sentences.english: The prospect of guessing sports lottery has a better market.
sentences.chinese: 競猜類體育彩票具有良好的市場前景。

sentences.english: But the reports say people will be able to win small prizes in a convoluted process described as a guessing game.
sentences.chinese: 但是報道稱，人們可以在有獎競猜中贏得較小的獎勵。

sentences.english: When it came to the quiz program, everyone gave their points of view on it .
sentences.chinese: 談到競猜節目的時候，每個人都發表各自的意見。

sentences.english: Welcome to the palace of wisdom. (
sentences.chinese: 歡迎來到智慧宮有獎競猜。

sentences.english: We have ample time to prepare for the contest.
sentences.chinese: 我們有充裕的時間爲競猜做準備。

definition: drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
